{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Mitsumi Electric |model=Wavit11 |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=06/13/2002 |manuf_country= |is_manuf=No |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=access point,bridge |fcc_id=EW4DWLA001 |ic_id= |us_id= |pwr_v=5 |pwr_amp=1.6 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_outer=4 |pwr_barrel_inner=1.6 |pwr_barrel_len=8.5 |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Mitsumi Electric |cpu1_model=MW5701 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand= |wi1_chip1_model= |wi1_chip2_brand=Intersil |wi1_chip2_model=HFA3861 |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=b |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu= |eth_chip1_brand=Davicom |eth_chip1_model=DM9008F |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=10M |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports= |addl_chips= |flags= |stock_boot= |stock_os= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=b |default_ssid=Wavit11 |default_ssid_regex=^Wavit11$ |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user= |default_pass=password |oui=00:A0:96 |oui_eth= |default_ch= }} [http://www.wikidevi.wi-cat.ru/files/vendors/Mitsumi/Wavit11.7z Copy of the included CD]
The device does not have a HTTP interface for configuration.
The default configuration has the device set to Ad-hoc mode with the SSID 'Wavit11'. The default Ad-hoc mode is not 802.11 compatible and thus the devices are invisible by default to 802.11 monitoring software. The devices may assume a Xircom MAC (OUI 00:10:A4) when in 802.11-compatible Ad-Hoc mode.
ID/OD/Len measurements are not exact.
The devices support the following modes.. *AdHoc *Infrastructure *Both (Ad-hoc + Infrastructure) *Access Point *Wireless Bridge *802.11 AdHoc
